Converted breech-loaded rifles have several issues. They have big caliber, because of which during fast shooting the barrel heats up so much that it becomes hard to handle rifle during reload or melee fighting. Inserted breech-loading mechanisms are not perfect and often cause cartridge case to jam inside after shot, and being hard to get out. Next step in firearms rearmament should be adopting new breech-loaded rifle: it will have much smaller caliber than before, which will improve bullet ballistics, and will have improved breech-loading mechanism, that will further increase rate of fire by making reloading process easier.^^Effects: army changes it's firearms to small-caliber breech-loading rifles.

Habéis nacido como {reg3?hija:hijo} de mercaderes ambulantes, siempre yendo de un sitio a otro en busca de beneficios. Aunque vuestros padres eran más ricos que muchos y os educaron tanto como pudieron, vos no tuvisteis demasiadas oportunidades para crear lazos de amistad con otras personas, ya que sólo visitabais las aldeas atendiendo al negocio familiar.

You were born the {reg3?daughter:son} of a small businessman, always dealing with different sorts of customers and partners. Your parents were wealth enough to send you to a private school. You father wasn't able to deal with the new times, which changed trading technoligies, so after his death you had only a small part of his business.

You were born the {reg3?daughter:son} of a minor staff officer, who took a part in a lot of conflicts of the early 19th century. Born in one of his campaigns, you never knew your mother. Although your father tried to teach you everything he knew, he wasn't a good teacher, so after his death you had only some army skills and his last bought gun.

You were born the {reg3?daughter:son} of a mafia capo, who was a respected member of a local band. Your father didn't want you to follow his steps, so you had a chance for a lawful life. But circumstances of the new times left you no choice, so after his death you replaced him with his mafia heritage.

You were born the {reg3?daughter:son} of a university professor. As a son of a science man, you got a very good education. Although your family wasn't rich your father tought you that money aren't the most important, so after his death you entered the world with a good amount of knowledge.

You were born the {reg3?daughter:son} of a regular factory laborer, who spent his life toughly working for his family. Although you were tought to live fairly, your father gave you freedom of chosing your future profession. After his death, you still was seeking for a business to get in your live.

Sois {reg3?una hija:un hijo} de la estepa, nacisteis en una tribu de nómadas que vivían en campamentos extendidos por las áridas praderas. Como otras gentes tribales, vuestra familia adoraba a los caballos sobre cualquier otra cosa, y os enseñaron a cabalgar antes incluso de que aprendierais a andar.

Como {reg3?hija:hijo} de un ladrón, habéis tenido poca educación formal. Os pasasteis la niñez en la calle, mendigando hasta que aprendisteis a robar monederos, y robando monederos hasta que aprendisteis a forzar cerraduras. Todos esos años, no obstante, os enseñaron a defenderos en la calle, así como los secretos de las ciudades y de los callejones oscuros.

You were, as far as anyone outside the university could tell, a studious person. Always obeying the rules, always getting good grades. If that was an illusion or not, only you know. But suffice you say, you were in university, be it because of a patronage from someone wealthy or because your family was rich enough to afford it, and even if you were a student whose record was questionable at best, it gained you valuable insight and experience.

The thrumming of machines and the pounding of metal is a sound you know better than anyone. It was hard work, waking up real early and going to bed real late, working every second between those two events under the watchful eye of demanding overseers. You became intimately familiar with technology, particularly industry, as you worked. Your calloused hands are proof that you know hard work, and though you left the factory life behind, it will never leave you.

Living on the streets was tough. Stealing to live, if you could call the scraps you could get any sort of proper life, was part and parcel of your existence. Everyone looked down at you as a street urchin, as someone to be reviled and pitied at best, or actively driven out at worst. This hard life gave you perspective, it gave you skills others may see as unsavory. Luckily, in war, unsavory skills are quite useful.

Extra extra! Local newspaper has a bunch of stories that you never really cared for! Hawking newspapers all day certainly improved your skills at speaking, making people who otherwise wouldn't care for the goings-on to buy a newspaper. Of course, a keen knowledge of business is hardly a bad thing. Perhaps the skills you learned will do you well in the new world you find yourself in.

Al abandonar la niñez, os enviaron a vivir a la corte de uno de los señores de aquellas tierras. Allí aprendisteis a ser humilde, mientras servíais a los señores y señoras de la casa. Pero de sus juegos de ajedrez, sus cotilleos, e incluso de sus poesías sobre grandes hazañas y amores de corte, aprendisteis todo acerca del conflicto y la competición del mundo de los adultos. También aprendisteis de los juegos que practicaban otros niños, que se golpeaban con palos imitando las espadas de sus mayores.

You were drawn to the human body, and how it functioned. Perhaps a family member got sick, and you vowed to help others through the same. Perhaps you liked giving people hope and treating them. Maybe you just liked cutting things apart. Either way, in college, you went into the fields of medicine.

Perhaps you live somewhere where grand architecture spirals up into the sky, or where imposing walls surrounded you. Or a small village, with beautiful and ancientchurches, was where your interest in buildings came. It doesn’t matter, because you loved buildings,and learned to raise them up in university. Perhaps now, you shall use that to tear them down.

Philology, the study of languages and how they compare, is extremely important to the diplomacy of Europe, where besides Latin, language like English, Russian, French, and so forth mustbe mastered. Studying this in university gave you a keen tongue and learned how to speak and communicate withthe high lords and common folk across the many realms of Europe.

You decided to lead a bohemian life, travelling from place to place playing music. This has put you in touch with the common people, and most of your interactions with higher society consisted of a tip of the hat when they tossed a coin into your cup. But still, you have learned how to advertise yourself, how to speak to a crowd, and how to entertain. All very useful skills, indeed.

You’re a businessperson, someone who has capital and funds enough to make more   capital. Perhaps you rose from the working class, or perhaps you started with a small loan from your family.   Either way, you’re well-off and can definitely get a foot in wherever you go now.

You fell into criminal life, and never really got out. The police know who you are    in some places, and in others they leer as if they should know you. No matter, of course, since between arrests   and brief jail times, you’ve learned how to survive outside the law.

You went to the Americas to seek a new life, perhaps to escape persecution   in Europe, perhaps to make a new life free from debts. Whatever your reasons, you took the journey   across to the Atlantic. And now, for whatever reason, you have returned to Europe.

You fought in the Crimea, either with or against Russia, and your   experiences in that war were invaluable and horrific. You saw men die, you saw foolish cavalry   charges, you saw the awesome power of cannons. As you returned home, weary and war-shocked, you knew you would never be the same.

Sólo vos sabéis cuál fue la causa de que abandonaseis vuestra antigua vida y os lanzaseis a la aventura. De todas formas, no fue una decisión difícil, habida cuenta la ira de vuestro corazón. Queréis venganza. Queréis justicia. Lo que os hicieron no puede ser desecho, y estas deudas sólo pueden ser pagadas con sangre...

Sólo vos sabéis cuál fue la causa de que abandonaseis vuestra antigua vida y os lanzaseis a la aventura. Lo único que podéis decir es que no soportabais quedaros, no con los dolorosos recuerdos de vuestros seres amados tan cerca. Tal vez vuestra nueva vida os permita olvidar, u honrar a aquéllos que no os atrevéis a nombrar...

Sólo vos sabéis cuál fue la causa de que abandonaseis vuestra antigua vida y os lanzaseis a la aventura. Ni siquiera os acordáis de por qué vuestra casa se convirtió en una prisión, de cuándo lo familiar se transformó en mundano, pero vuestros deseos de aventura inundaron vuestra vida. Ya sea que soñáis con llegar a un lugar lejano o simplemente deseáis caminar sin rumbo y libremente, no podíais soportar quedaros en el mismo lugar. Simplemente echasteis a andar, y nunca más mirasteis atrás...

Sólo vos sabéis cuál fue la causa de que abandonaseis vuestra antigua vida y os lanzaseis a la aventura. Sin embargo, sabéis que no podéis regresar. No hay nada ni nadie a donde regresar. Vuestro hogar ya no existe y debéis aceptar que os enfrentáis al mundo {reg3?sola:solo}, para ahogaros o salir a flote...

Sólo vos sabéis cuál fue la causa de que abandonaseis vuestra antigua vida y os lanzaseis a la aventura. Para todos los demás, está claro que lo único que os motiva es el beneficio personal. Queréis riquezas, poder, que os respeten y que os teman. Queréis ser la persona a la que los demás obedecen. Queréis que la gente conozca vuestro nombre y tiemble cada vez que se pronuncie. Lo queréis todo, y no permitiréis que nadie se interponga en vuestro camino...

Como última medida defensiva, os retiráis a la sala principal de la fortaleza. Vos y vuestros últimos soldados lucharéis allí desesperadamente. Si os derrotan, no tenéis ya ningún lugar a donde escapar.
Habéis perdido los muros de la ciudad. Los atacantes anegan ya las calles. Si podéis vencerlos, tal vez podáis cambiar vuestra suerte.

¡Habéis conseguido atravesar los muros de la ciudad, pero los obstinados defensores continúan la resistencia en las calles! Tendréis que ocuparos de ellos antes de poder atacar el corazón de la fortaleza.
The town is yours, but the remaining defenders have retreated to the castle. It must fall before you can complete your victory.
Los últimos defensores se han refugiado en el castillo como última barrera. Debéis entrar y aplastar a la resistencia.
Sin embargo, al no haber jurado lealtad a {s9}, no hay posibilidad de que él os reconozca como {señor/señora} de {reg8?esta ciudad:este castillo}.
El enemigo ha sido obligado a retirarse. El asalto ha concluido, pero el asedio continúa.
Los guardias del castillo os ven cuando intentáis acercaros. Inmediatamente abren las puertas a su {rey/reina}.
Los guardias del castillo os descubren cuando intentáis acercaros. Inmediatamente abren las puertas a su {señor/señora}.
Esta aldea y sus tierras colindantes os pertenecen.
Recordáis que esta aldea y sus tierras colindantes pertenecen al {s7}.
Estas tierras no pertenecen a nadie.
La aldea ha sido saqueada. Unas pocas almas se dispersan mientras pasáis por entre las casas quemadas.
Nadie parece estar interesado en unirse a vuestro grupo.
Un {s3} se ofrece voluntario a seguiros.

Por más que lo intentasteis, no pudisteis vencer a los bandidos. Llenos de ira, arrasan la aldea para castigar a los campesinos, y luego dejan atrás las tierras que acaban de incendiar para buscar otros sitios que saquear.
Los asesinos os golpean hasta dejaros inconsciente en el suelo y se van creyendo haberos matado.
Habéis caído. Los bandidos rebuscan rápidamente en vuestro cuerpo para robaros lo que tenéis, y desaparecen en la noche. Os han dejado con vida, aunque poco les ha faltado para mataros.
Por fortuna, algunos de vuestros compañeros llegan buscándoos y os encuentran en el suelo. Rápidamente os llevan a un sitio seguro y atienden vuestras heridas.
Por fortuna, algunos campesinos os encuentran en la cuneta y se percatan de que no sois cualquiera. Ellos os llevan a una posada cercana y atienden vuestras heridas.
Sois incapaz de robar el ganado.
Sacáis {reg17} {reg12?cabezas:cabeza} de ganado del rebaño de la aldea.
You see the flag of {s7} over the town gates.
Your own flag flies over the town gates.
You see the flag of {s7} over the town gates.
Habéis sido capaz de pasar sin que os detectaran.
{s13} Pronto se celebrará un torneo aquí.
You are not allowed here (need to have relation with faction 5 and higher).
Además, ganáis {reg8} denares por las astutas apuestas que habéis hecho sobre vuestra persona...
¡La victoria es vuestra! Habéis ganado este combate, pero ahora debéis prepararos para la próxima ronda.
Os han vencido en este combate, pero el maestro de ceremonias reconoce vuestra habilidad y valentía, permitiéndoos participar en la siguiente ronda.
Os han vencido. Los campesinos están felices de su éxito, pero la lección que intentabais inculcarles probablemente no les ha llegado...
Tras vencer a vuestro último oponente, explicáis a los campesinos cómo defenderse contra un ataque así. Esperáis que hayan aprendido y la próxima vez puedan defenderse solos.
¡Los bandidos han sido derrotados! Los pocos que quedan vivos y conscientes huyen con el rabo entre las piernas, aterrorizados de los campesinos y de su nuevo líder.
Sin embargo, {reg3?no sois:{s1} no es} capaz de encontrar mercancías de comercio que puedan procurar ganancias.
^Comprar {s4} aquí e ir a {s5} para vender os reportará una ganancia de {reg6} denares por unidad.{s3}
{s2}^{s1} ha ganado {reg0} puntos adicionales de experiencia.
El entrenamiento no ha ido nada bien.
El entrenamiento no ha ido demasiado bien.
{s13} os ha pedido que reportéis ante él con al menos {reg13} tropas.
{s13} os ha ordenado que os unáis en el asalto a {s14}.
Debéis buscar y hablar con {s3} de {s4} para ofrecerle vuestro juramento de lealtad.

^^Notad que mientras seáis mariscal los señores del reino esperan que seáis vos quien los lidere en las campañas. Así que si estáis esperando por un banquete, ya sea por una boda u otro motivo, puede que queráis dimitir. Para ello debéis hablar con vuestro señor.

Days after peaceful protests began, backlashes from many organizations, still not yet bore a fruit. The government decided to ignore the demands from the protesters. The government has only given them pain instead of listening them for fair investigations, leading to more and more widespread protests across the country. And now, the government has two decision, whether to comply or just simply, refuse.^^Effects: Socialist movement popularity increased by 10%.

After hearing about the protests, being a nuisance for the government, the government decided to dispatch some policemen to disperse the crowd of protesters by non-lethal means. They tried to disperse the crowd with whips and baton and it resulted in a success. Some of the protesters thrown rocks and debris to the officers but all of them have been arrested in the following afternoon. The last of the protesters finally dispersed after some of the demonstration leaders escaped the scene.^^Effects: Socialist movement popularity increased by 5%. Socialist movement radicalism increased by 3%.

At noon, when the demonstration leader was making a speech about their demands infront of the crowd of protesters, troops and policemen entered the scene to disperse the crowd. Unfortunately, the government ordered the dispersion with a violent way. Then, soldiers opened fire on the protesters, killing and wounding many people. Others, tried to flee from the scene, ran either wounded or dying. Few managed to hide from the law enforcement and the dispersion is successful. The government quickly received backlashes from peace organizations, socialists and even foreign countries alike, thus souring foreign relations. ^^ Socialist movement radicalism increased by 10%.

¡Alto! Vuestro dinero o vuestra vida, {amigo/niña}. No os mováis o lo lamentaréis.
Por suerte para su excelencia, estoy de buen humor. Dadnos todo el dinero y puede que os dejemos vivir.

hemos progresado muy poco hasta ahora
hemos conseguido ganar algo de terreno, pero aún nos falta bastante para llegar
nos hemos convertido en una fuerza significativa, y tenemos posibilidades de victoria
estamos ganando la guerra, pero nuestros enemigos aún resisten.
estamos a punto de alcanzar la victoria. Los enemigos que restan no son una amenaza, pero aún debemos acabar con ellos.

Ever since the fall of the Holy Roman Empire, the Austrian Emperor has been doing their best to undermine Northern conglomeration efforts. We will have to defeat and dissolve the weak German Confederation, lead by the Austrians, in order to rise to the position of a German hegemon, and annex the Kingdom of Hannover.^^ - Defeat the German Confederation armies belonging to Austria, Wurtemberg and Hannover^ - Conquer and hold the Bavarian fortification of Nuremberg ^ - Conquer the capital city of Stuttgart^ - Sign peace with German Confederation on conditions of taking Nuremberg and Stuttgart^^ We will be able to hold onto any conquests we make during the war, and our ultimate goal is to annex the Northern German states. Victory will pave the way to ultimate unification after we take back Alsace-Lorraine.

War with France has broken out, and our goal will be to utterly destroy them, take back German clay in Alsace-Lorraine, and ultimately declare Empire under our soon-to-be Emperor {playername}. It's time to display to the Southern Germans, foremost the Bavarians, that we are indeed capable of defending and leading the German people.^^ - Conquer the French border city of Strasbourg^ - Annihilate the French Army entirely^ - Sign peace with France on conditions of taking Strasbourg^^Let a united Germany rise from the ashes of the 2nd French Empire.

The first step towards German unification must be the reconquest of the Northern German regions of Schleswig, Holstein, and Lauenburg, which, for the past centuries, have been under occupation by the Danish Kingdom. Taking back the region, and destroying the Danish in the process, would certainly display might and competence in the eyes of the German states.^^ - Conquer the city of Kiel.^ - Defeat the Danish armies and destroy their economy to force them to surrender.^ - Sign peace with Denmark on conditions of taking Kiel^^Once we've defeated the Danes, we can move on to our Southern rival, the Austro-Hungarian Empire.
Papal State, and our primary Italian adversary, the Kingdom of Two Sicilies
Papal State, and our primary Italian adversary, the Kingdom of Sardinia
Kingdom of Two Sicilies, and our primary Italian adversary, the the Kingdom of Sardinia
Your highness, those people are our allies! We will be condemned by the entire international community, and lose a valuable ally! Are you sure?
We've agreed by truce not to attack them, at least for the moment being. We will face extreme scrutiny if we do, regardless of how righteous our cause my be. Are you sure?
Considering we have a valid reason to attack {s31}, I don't see any inherent reason why this should speak against us. If you wish, I will send out a message to their ambassador immediately.

I am afraid we don't have a justification for conflict at this point in time. We can naturally still declare war against {s31}, but expect international pressure to mount extremely quickly, and for it to put us in the crossfire of future and ongoing conflicts.
This is my decision to make, go ahead anyways.
Then send that ambassador a message, and one to our generals, too.
You have my blessings, go ahead.
Let's not act rashly. We have all the time we need, let's wait.
Hold it, then, we can't get ourselves condemned by a dozen nations at once!
This will be unnecessary bloodshed through and through. Hold off on it.
With our state-controlled press, we can surely achieve a good result.
Because of free press laws in our country, campaign will not be much effective.
With our censorship, we will be able to significantly reduce influence of our political opponents and get quite good results.
I want to start repressions against our political opponents.
We need to decrease influence of our opponents in the political arena.

Most certainly. Arrests of influential figures of the political opposition will undermine their positions in the political arena and strengthen ours. Investigation will take 10 days and {reg1} pounds per day.

Most certainly. Few revelatory articles condemning our opponents in illegal actions, aiding enemy and treason will dishonor them before the eyes of our people, and strengthen our position. The whole process will take 10 days and {reg1} pounds per day.
However, in case of failure, our opponents can condemn us as answer to our actions.

{playername}, cuando comencé mi larga andadura, poca gente tuvo el coraje de apoyarme. Mucho menos aún de arriesgar su vida por mi causa. Pero vos no os lo pensasteis dos veces y cargasteis contra mis enemigos. Hemos pasado por muchas cosas juntos, y hubo momentos en los que casi perdí la esperanza. Pero con la ayuda de Dios hemos prevalecido. Es tiempo para mí de abandonaros  y tomar lo que es mío por derecho. De hoy en adelante asumiré la gran responsabilidad de gobernar {s3}. Sé que aún nos esperan muchos desafíos y cuento con vuestra ayuda para superarlos. Y por supuesto, no habrá mejor vasallo para mí que vos.
Por supuesto tendremos que esperar a que el reino no esté en campaña.
